Reviews: and now we are on year two—the bag is still fully functional. for the past two years this bag has been indoors a total of four nights, nights where the threat of heavy freezing rain would hinder the morning commute. the rest of the time it is in the new england elements. i’ll add a photo. it is faded to a very light gray, but zipper still fine and it carries my stuff just fine.after one year, i’m writing a new review. i have an interesting bicycle life: i commute by bicycle. i ride twelve miles to work five days a week, regardless of temperature or conditions. so give or take a few dozen miles, i bike about 3,000 miles per year.i also abuse my bike. i leave it outside in snow, sleet, rain, hail, and the summer sun. it is a 1995 trek iron horse. it is a beast. so any equipment i purchase is in for a test.i’m uploading a photo of this bag one year later. it is a little faded, but it is as functional as the day i strapped it on. i truly thought i would get a few months out of it at maximum. judging from its condition after 3,000 miles, i think i’ll get many more years out of it.it is spacious enough to hold my iphone, a boo kit, a repair kit, my keys, and a sandwich. it is a remarkable piece of equipment. i have bought two more, one for my other bike and one as a gift.

this is one of those products that actually looks better when you get it! i was a little hesitant in purchasing this as i thought it would not allow room for my water bottle and hand air pump-- no problem, take a look at attached images. the bonus is it holds my leatherman wave knife w/ belt case, note 8 w/ extra large case, tire patch kit, wallet and pro bike tool mini ratchet tool set with a tiny bit of room left over. it also stays secure and out of the way while pedaling.it is an amazing bike storage bag and extremely user friendly taking a full 2 minutes to install! as you can see by the picture i purchased another one. we ride in the northwest mountains of maine and enjoy carrying all the essentials without a back pack or saddle bags.highly recommend this product!recommendation: recommend applying lip balm (bees wax) to the zipper to keep zipper opening easily and to prevent undue stress on the stitching.happy trails! :)

i love this frame bike bag! well made, big enough but not bulky, straps on securely! i use it to carry a tire repair kit with pump, my key fob and wallet. doesn't get in the way while riding! looks great!!! very functional and keeps it's shape! if you're looking for a nice carry bag for your bike, this is it!!!

this is a very nice bag for the money. very functional. i use mine to store my tools, mini pump, spare tube etc. be aware that if your top tube slants down, it will be a tight fit with your water bottle (see picture). my bike is a trek fx2 hybrid with an angled top tube so this bag pushes up against the water bottle and looks a little weird. but it fits and works fine.

i put topeak bike rack on my other bikes and also have a topeak saddle bag. i didn't want to put a rack on this mountain bike as i want to keep it light. i didn't want to use a saddle bag because i need to adjust the seat height during my rides and the saddle bag would be a problem. i also have a backpack and a waist pack but the backpack isn't that comfortable and the waist pack is simply too small for storage. when i saw the aduro storage bag, i thought it was perfect. it is actually a pretty large storage bag and can hold a lot of stuff. i need to carry a spare tube, co2 tire inflator or topeak peakini mini pump, phone, keys, nutrition bar, etc.. with this bag, i can comfortably carry all my essential items (not including my bike lock)..... con? none so far. it makes contact with my thermos water bottle but not an issue.

works extremely well. it would be perfect except it doesn't hang absolutely centered under the cross bar due to positioning of velcro straps. however, that's not a performance issue. it's large and easily holds an iphone6+, xtra tubes and repair stuff. i'm 6'2" and have a large bike frame, and the size still interferes with a water bottle on the seat tube, so i just bought a larger bottle for the down tube bottle cage.

the straps are so long the fuzzy part ends up overlapping itself and the velcro cannot secure itself down. the stitch job connecting the velcro is pathetic. made with zero quality assurance. it was also punctured 6 different times to secure the cardboard packaging with the branding on it. who does that? just outright damages the product just to hold cardboard in place. it was already bagged. redundant. these products are shamelessly mass produced with not a care in the world if all of it ends up in a landfill. how hard is it to actually look at the product and test it along the way!?

this seemed like a winner. i found a nice way to hang it off the top bar, velcro held well, bag zipped well. i loaded it with a small battery op pump, a wrench and a multitool. maybe 3 pounds of stuff, and i left it for the night. planning a 40 mile run in the morning, so i wanted some emergency supplies.when i wheeled it out the next morning, one of the three straps had ripped loose completely from the stitching. was just hanging there. keep in mind this was before i'd driven the bike at all, before i'd taken it over any bumps or anything.useless.

this bag is just what i was looking for. it is roomy enough for emergency tools and a patch kit as well as a compact tire pump plus my cell phone! i like the blue color as it matches my new bike too. being a larger bag it fits snugly between the upright and cross member and brushes against the water bottle holder. i was worried it might interfere with peddling however it does not. the only improvement i could suggest is making the velcro straps about a quarter inch or third of an inch longer to accommodate thicker cross members.

i like this aduro sport bicycle bike storage bag.my carbon road bike has a slightly awkward shape triangle, and nothing exactly fits inside, along with my water bottles.while this pack didn't quite fit either, i find a quite useful alternate mounting position that i very much like.i have it inverted on my top tube, just under the forward side of my saddle. unconventional location, but it fits perfectly, makes for an aero flow in front to my post, doesn't impede my pedaling, looks good too.the bag is well made, holds a tube, co2 inflator and 2 cartridges, allen wrenches, protein bar, and has some room left.the zipper is very smooth; but in my unusual configuration, it hangs down so i use a small bit of teflon coated copper wire to hold it up. probably no one else using this pack would need this workaround.i haven't ridden in the rain, so can't speak to that.i've had it in use for about a month and am very pleased.

updated review:so i've had this item for just over a year now and it's falling apart! i've had to re-sew all the velcro straps but the underlying fabric is just coming apart.so..i added denim patches on the inside where the straps attach and sewed them to reinforce those areas... held for a little bit but the fabric is such crap (strands instead of mesh) that it's just falling apart around the patch!now.. the heaviest thing i'm carrying is small frame lock... along with my phone, a few allen wrenches, patch kit, etc.i doubt the entire bag & contents weighs even 5 lbs.waste of money!especially considering that my previous bike bag lasted more than 25 yrs! again it's only been one year.. maybe 150 days of riding!original review:i like the size, ease of installation and placement. time will tell how sturdy it is. my biggest qualm with the bag is that the yellow color is not what is represented. my monitor is excellently color calibrated and the yellow on the bag is more of a dull w/ slight green undertones as opposed to the vibrant golden/sun yellow in the picture.

i bought the bag to be able to stash my wallet and keys in while riding but wanted something slim i wouldn't notice on the bike. this bag fit perfect on my trek marlin 5. build seems okay, my only worry is the longevity of the velcro in dusty/dirty conditions but time will tell.

as opposed to what others have mentioned, the straps actually do hold very tightly and i mountain bike very hard and rough on my bike. the people that said they were loose didn't know how to put the straps on properly. although to be fair, i'm not an engineer and had to call my engineer friend from work to show me how to strap them on properly (i felt extremely dumb even though i'm normally good mechanically). my pride and dignity aside, they don't strap on like any other strap i've ever put on, but they work perfectly!100% satisfied! just make sure if you have a waterbottle holder, that the dimensions of this won't collide. my bike's geometry does cause it to collide a bit, but practically speaking is not an issue. i couldn't find anything else on the market that was big enough like this one and actually worked well. would recommend

bought for my wife for her charge fat tire bike to carry small items - mainly cell phone. the behind the seat bag on her road and cross bikes wouldn't work because of rear fender and lower seat height. this is much handier for her anyway. i'll probably get one for my fat tire bike too.

this unit might not be for you because it is fairly large but so far i have found it to be very good. i keep a hex head tool, canister inflater, tire removal levers, and patches in it as well as car keys. it has a net inside to allow one to minimally organize items. zipper is on the edge of the top for easy access when mounted. good quality material. and the velcro straps work well on my aluminum tubes. an added plus is the gap between the top tube and seat tube that accommodates the prong on my allen hitch-mounted bicycle carrier. my top tube is horizontal so you may not have such a gap on a sloped top tube. so far i like it the best of the carrier gizmos i've tried. if you carry a water bottle on the seat tube it will probably get in the way. i carry mine of the down tube.

this item is sturdy and will likely last. however.1. one really can't open it when it is mounted.2. with my bike rack, the item must be removed to mount the bike (that's on me for not recognizing before purchase).3. the mounting bracket the attaches to the seat post immediately took paint off. i don't care given that my bike is roughly handled, but many would care about this.if i buy something similar again, it will be one of those little bags that hangs under the seat.

i’ve never seen such a poorly designed item that received 5 stars.here are the problems with it:1) the velcro straps are not suitable for small to medium diameter frame bars. if you try to install on a small diameter bar, the strap will wrap around so far that it won’t match up the velcro to the catchy part. this means you have to loosen the strap but then the bag moves around and isn’t secure.2) the velcro straps are reversed. they should have the ends wind up on the opposite side of where the zipper opens up. as it is, the strap ends dangle in front of the zipper and are a nuisance when trying to reach your hand in there.3) be warned that the “red” color is more of a burnt orange, not a true red.4) there was some messy stitching on this bag which is easily visible and i wouldn’t count on it lasting.

disclaimer: i did have something heavy in the bag. however, it only lasted a week riding around a college campus with this heavy thing secured inside and all the velcro loops securely attached as they are designed to do. one of the plastic buckle-ish-things that hold the velcro straps together (i.e., the piece that makes the strap a strap) broke during a pretty normal ride. i hit plenty of bumps, but the bag has enough space to hold much more weight and therefore be studied in my opinion.speaking of space, it is quite roomy and attached quite well. it did not move around much, and i think with less than 3 or 4 lbs of stuff inside, it might hold up very well. i did not test its waterproofness. i liked the concept and design of the bag. i have made/modified many storage pouches for backpacks, tactical vests, web belts, etc., so i will testify that the materials of this bag are its killer. if you want something that will last and hold up to anything forceful or stressful on its components... this is probably not your bag. it is not durable nylon or plastic and the stitches are not very neat either.

with much anticipation, waited for the color i wanted to get of this bag. upon mounting, realized it's quite large and roomy, which is great and all, but if you have any sort of water bottle holder? fuhgetaboutit! just won't fit right, and if you wedge it between the bottle holder, it will push it's way to the left of the frame, off center. to make matters worse, i was trying to adjust the fit, when one of the very thin plastic clips that the velcro loops through broke, making it sag even more, and making it worthless to me now. 2 stars because it's a nice bag with a lot of room, but cheap components to mount with. what a disappointment!

the first thing i found out, after installing before a 45 mile ride (reason i needed a bigger bag) was that when mounted inside the frame, under the seat post, the vertical bottle holder on the seat post frame was not useable. so while i have 2 bottle holders, only the forward more angular one was useable. the bag is long and make even a short bottle a not worth it option. however, the bag does its job and holds a lot of stuff, and compliments an under seat (off the back) bag perfectly. used it to hold a couple energy bars, some gel chews, my phone... and when halfway i took my sleeves off and put them in the bag too. it was secure and didn't wobble around. so, a very good purchase, but the extra bottle loss can be a big deal to some...

the bag was delivered very quickly. it seems to be of good quality with strong velcro straps, sturdy fabric, and a smooth working zipper. it is easy to mount to the bike and stays in place perfectly. there is some stiffness to the fabric and gravity does the rest to keep it where it belongs. i hardly know it is there but it is large enough to hold my phone, lip balm, wallet, keys, sunglasses and room for more.bike clothes are not known for an abundance of pockets so this bag lets me take the items i need in a compact and secure manner.edit: i have had this bag for a year now. it is still as good as new even after 3000 miles of sun and rain exposure. it does fade a little but a treatment of '303 protectant' brings is back to new (temporarily). i now have a second one for my second bike.

i've had this bag for 13 months and i just replaced it with something else (it's seen ~2,000 miles of road time). still technically works, but it's starting to fail in the place i was initially worried about upon buying it... the top tube strap attachment points. i just don't think you can use this design with a bag with this much volume. either it gets filled with stuff that weighs it down, pulling at those attachment points, or you don't put that much in it, and it flops around, pulling at those attachment points. the bag i replaced it with has molle-type loops with separate velcro straps, which i feel does a better job of distributing the weight on the stitching.

the color i received was nothing like the golden yellow that is pictured. instead, what i received is a pale faded out yellow with an odd neon green tinge. the packaging shows that sporty neon green color, the seller’s picture shows a rich golden yellow, and the product itself is neither color! i would’ve taken one color or the other but this is coloration is so appauling i can’t even stand it on my bike. now i get to experience the pleasure to return the item at my convenience because the seller is misrepresenting the product. the picture is a complete misrepresentation of what you will receive if you order the yellow.

my biggest pet peeve is that it’s hard to center with the seat tube. it attaches to the frame fine and takes some trimming depending on your bike, but the attachment that secures to the seat tube is too far up on the bag, causing the bottom portion of the case to sway back and forth while riding, or just be lopsided. i only carry a tool, my lights and a small back up pump so it’s not a lot of weight. i would love to be able to fit my lock in there too but there isn’t quite enough room. i guess you get what you pay for, i just don’t like that sometimes it gets lopsided enough to where my foot and/or leg brush against it from time to time.

this is exactly what i needed to keep clutter out of my pockets while riding. i can hold my phone, keys, wallet, and even sunglasses no problem. the only bummer is i have to detach this when putting my bike on my hitch rack when driving. other than that the three straps take little time to reattach. my rides are much more enjoyable without stuff in my pockets. i do not ride in the rain therefore cannot comment on weather resistance.**update** dec. 2020 - i have owned this for 9 months. the straps that attach to my bike frame are loose now. i took one star away because it could be sewn better. i am using safety clips now. eventually i will need to replace product as i feel it is not meant to last for years.

i just bought a $3k e-bike (electric bike), & have enhanced it with remote-controlled turn signals, a gps unit, & even custom-designed foot pegs! along the way, i've put together an entire set of tools to adjust everything. i was looking for a bicycle pouch that wouldn't get in the way of riding, & this pouch is perfect! took < 1 minute to install. only problem is that the fuller it is, the harder it is to open & close. however, because everything else is just right for my needs, only loses 1*.highly recommended, especially if you don't want bulky saddle bags poking out from the frame of your bike / e-bike!

not a bad frame triangle bag. the velcro straps are long enough to go around thicker bike frame tubes and it sits fairly well on the bike with sloping top tube. not perfect, but not bad. the size of the bag is okay, and the volume inside is more than expected by looking at it... the way the velcro is mounted to the bag doesn't look like it will stand the test of time, but only time will tell. the material is okay for this price point. the bag is okay for this price point.better than nashbar's triangle bag... what a piece of junk that is... they use to sell good bags, but not anymore.we'll see how it holds up over time.

bought this for an old schwinn road bike. the straps are long enough that when pulled tight they can not fasten. i have to double them around, and the hook and loop fastener is only making about a square centimeter of contact. i will probably cut the straps and sew them back on after removing some as it doesn't seem like this will be very secure on a bumpy road.the bag seems pretty low quality all around but sufficient for its intended purpose.

this bag is pretty large. it has lots of room. it only seems to fit under the seat of my bike, the straps are not optional to place it on the front. the zipper is on the left side so you can only open it from the left because of how it has to be installed due to where the straps are. therefore, i have to get off my bike to get something out of it. it's a good bag however, the 2 things i don't care for are where it can be installed and the opening on the wrong side for me. otherwise there's plenty of room to put things in it. i'll get used to the downfalls.

i bought two of these in hopes that i could use on my bike and grandsons. unfortunately, because of where the bars are place and where the zipper opens they did not fit. but that being said, i wish they would have fit because they seemed very well made and if they would have fit, i would have liked them. didn't put them in a rain storm but the zipper seems very snug and the velcro adheres well for a snug fit on the bike. loved the colors as well. i could get it on the one bike but the zipper pointed down so if i would have stored anything in it, when unzipped it would have all fallen out. might be great for a mens bike but unisex and women's the straps are not placed to where it will fit. i returned and got a refund very quickly which says a lot for the seller!!

i was happy when i received and started using in july 2020, it's now september and bike pack is starting to fall apart. noticed a small hole developing after less than two months! would i order one again, maybe, if it was better built. if the developer/creator wants to make a better bag, use better fabric and stitching. may i also recommend that once you unzip this is one big bag, meaning no inside pockets or elastic to hold keys or hold clip.i would not order this product again without being reworked and of course it's too late to return.

for what it is, a flimsy pouch, it's very much overpriced. it does the job, so it will work just fine for my needs. the velcro straps seem to be made for thicker frames and are too large for smaller ones. i had to give it some slack to properly secure the velcro and then i had to cute the end of the strap short. the item has a strong distinct petroleum based chemical smell, which is probably not safe in the long run. i suspect that this has to do with their waterproof coating. as long as you don't touch it too much and keep it on your bike, it should be fine.

i've ridden several hundred miles with the bag. my only problem is that it hangs down far enough that i can not get a water bottle into the holder on the seat tube. i have a large (60 cm) frame with a horizontal top tube. i'd guess everyone will have the same problem. however, it does hold tools, an inflator with spare cartridges, a couple of tubes, wallet, and phone. it has a nice inner pocket to help keep thing separated. it stays out of my way when riding, but is easier to access than a bag mounted behind the seat.

i bought this bag for my wife's new specialized street-mountain bike to replace an old under-the-seat bag that interfered with a new rear light. initially i was worried that this new bag would not fit well in the frame at the seat post end because the angle was not 90 degrees. but, it did fit well, and is successful. the reason i don't give this 5 stars is that the velcro loops for attaching to the frame are really intended for round frame tubes. the new bike has a wide oval frame tube for the cross bar. it works, but this arrangement leads to some interference between the zipper and frame tube. realizing this, i can arrange the velcro to mostly keep the zipper away from the frame. i am still considering if i should add some friction tape on the frame, but i don't like the idea of the glue on the tape getting gummy in summer heat. the manufacturer should consider an updating the design to prevent contact between the frame and the zipper and accommodate non-round frame tubes. as a small aside, the purple trim on the pouch matches the deep purple frame color on the new bike.

i purchased this bag to carry my on the road tools while i’m out on my bicycle, it works like a charm the straps keep it in place firmly i have not had to adjust once yet and i’ve had it for over a month on average i ride 13 miles per day.it’s currently carrying a mini bike pump, tire patches, and a bicycle repair tool, as well as my charging cord for my bicycle light. in addition to those things it was able to carry all of those items plus my phone, car keys and wallet with no issues.if you are planning on being a serious cyclist you will need to carry emergency equipment and tools and you would need a bag like this for your journey/adventures. i would highly recommend this bag, the material is nice and sturdy. i don’t ride in the rain but if i did i’m fully confident that the bag would not deteriorate.i hope you find this review helpful.

if i had bought this for myself and used it to carry keys or my cell phone, then i'd give this a higher review as it does attach easily and does carry stuff that you'd rather not keep in your pocket. the trouble is that i bought this for my developmentally disabled brother. when my parents passed away and i became his guardian he was 272 lbs. i got him into a gym with a personal trainer, worked with a nutritionist to change his diet, and promised him a red trek electric bicycle (his dream) if he got to 199 lbs. he did it, but the bike is expensive, so i got him an expensive chainlock and this case to hold it. it fits in the case nicely, but after two weeks the straps started coming loose from the case. i fastened them back with stove bolts and they held nicely, but then the zipper broke and is just not repairable. i gave it two stars because i feel people who give one star lose credibility because they sound like mr. crankypants. i'm not cranky and i'm not saying don't buy this. just don't expect much from it.

i bought a couple of these because the reviews looked good, but am really not happy with them. few things i'd change:* the velcro needs to be shorter so it's possible to get it tight on the bike frame.* the seat tube velcro needs to be closer to the bottom of the bag to keep it from swinging.* the rear top tube velcro needs to be further back, again, to keep the bag from swinging* the three velcro pieces need to be centered on the width of the bag. as it is, the bag sticks out an inch further to one side of the bike frame because the velcro is offset.

i am a diabetic. when i ride, i need to take my blood testing kit, snacks, glucose gel packets, keys, id, money, and my phone—too much for comfortably stuffing in pockets. this storage bag holds it all comfortably. it is easy to put on and take off the bike so i can use it as a purse if we stop for a bite to eat somewhere. the fabric is tough—which is good, except that if i get the bag too full, my legs rub against it as i ride, so the rough fabric rubs my skin. newer versions could maybe have a smooth nylon outside layer? but all in all, this is exactly what i needed.

a very nice bag perfect for larger phones. i have one with a 6 in screen and the bags easily holds the phone, keys, money, bike tool, and, in today's world, a mask and gloves. i could also add a puncture repair kit if i wanted. the bag seems well made. i have not tried it in the rain so i don't know how waterproof it is. the only possible downside to its size is that it restricts the size of water bottle that could be carried in the rear bracket to the very shortest ones. not a problem for me as i only carry one bottle.

i like the size of this case because it allows for a lot of stuff to carry and the zipper being on the top is nice to keep it from opening and losing stuff.my only comment is the velcro straps are weird in how they fasten. they are long, which is good because it accounts varying distances and bar sizes, however the way they fasten seems to be upside down. when i wrap, there is only a small surface of velcro that grabs, so not certain of how bumpy rides may affect the strength of grip.

my first time having a bike since childhood and i was really excited to find this storage back. it's a great size to hold my wallet, gate opener, and keys. actually has a good bit of space where i could add a few more items if needed. it is not secure, however. if you are going to park your bike and run into a store or building you should take out the contents because there is no way to add a lock. even if you could lock it - it is easily removed from the bike so i would not suggest leaving valuables unattended in this pouch. serves it's purpose, sturdy and useful. i have not tried it in the rain so i do not know if it is waterproof or not. great find!

so i’ve only had a short time but so far so good. 2 secs to put on and looks good. the mesh pocket separator within is a nice touch for cell phone or wallet. plenty of additional room for keys, etc. only negative is that to close or open the zipper requires 2 hands for me. i’d like to keep one hand on bike and open with other but no good.

this order is waiting to replace the one in use already. its been over two years but i can see that the attach straps are on the verge of tearing loose from the bag itself. too bad. the bag is in a1 shape and if not for the straps could easily last another two years.its been a good bag for the storage of tools, oil, patches, extra tube etc etc.very good in wet weather. where i live showers are a givin.other than that its a good bag.

what a neat storage bag fits great and really easy to use. nice color and that new nylon feel. the straps are easy to work with. but, made in china sucks when it could be made in the usa instead! that's another story. i also like the little fish-net pocket inside the storage bag. theres not much to say about a bicycle storage bag thats a triangle shaped as the official pictures shows. it is recommended and its really cool and i love it!

looks nice. appears to be quite rugged. attaches very easily to a bike. lots of extra in each strap to go around thicker bars or compensate for different angles. stays in the middle. away from feet and legs. so far i have only put my cable bike lock and a small bottle of water (250ml) into it. but there is still more space, will have to get a small bike repair kit to add. will hold a 500ml bottle and a few other things. it can move around a bit when attached so if you bump it, it might go out of place, but won't detach. but as long as you don't touch it it stays where it is. and is easily nudged back into place. nice pouch. i'd say 4.5 stars, but it won't let me.

looks cheap. made kind of cheap. the velcro straps get in the way of the brake cable. buy the ibera bag instead. it is much nicer. and the way the straps are sewn on the ibera, it does not interfere at all with the brake cable. i ordered both bags because i wasn't crazy about the orange trim on the ibera and wanted a purple bag to match my bike. but the purple aduro bag is going back. i can definitely deal with the ibera orange trim because the quality is so much better.

first, let's just say that i, at almost 60 years old, am just taking up the sport of cycling. i need to get in shape. so i know very little about bicycles and accessories. second, i waited for a few weeks before i wrote my review to make sure that (a) my inexperience is a factor in the review, and (b) i wanted to try to give this a shot and have it work in a way not advertised.i knew that i needed to get something to store a few things in as i ride. while this looked like a winner, when i received it, i was unable to put where i expected under the seat, anchored by velcro straps for the crossbar and the seat bar (sorry is this is not how these are identified). my water bottle was in the way -- and it's not even close. i tried to put this only using two straps on the crossbar, but it flops around so much as to be distracting when i ride.i won't use this anymore, but i might find a friend who could use this if their water bottle were mounted on the diagonal bar. too bad, it does have good storage space for my large android phone, spare tube, and miscellaneous other things.the seller should note this in the product description somewhere so that others don't experience the same frustration.

compact yet can hold essentials. inexpensive. gave three stars for water resistance because i have not ridden in the rain with it and do not intend to ride in the rain unless caught out there. two stars for security as there is none. does not lock and even if it did you just undo the velcro straps and by by. if they mean how it secures to the bike than four stars, your not going to carry a ton of weight in this. i intend to put small tools and maybe my cell phone, it is sufficient for that. it is out of the way and comes in a color that should match your ride. would buy again.

was planning a "bike-packing" trip with my son's explorer troop. needed additional storage space at hand so this was a nice addition to my set up. super easy to install and stays where you put it. enough space for a phone and charger, plus a small sunscreen, and a few bars for snacks. did not interfere with getting my mini-pump off the cross bar nor getting the water bottle out of the holder. got rained on and stuff inside stayed dry. got slopped with mud and it washed off easily with no damage to pouch. recommend!

i've had this bag about 3 months. i ride my local mtb trails (houston, tx) about 3 to 5 times a week and use this to carry my multi-tool, phone, keys, and a sweat rag. not much weight at all. as you can see in the picture, the threads are coming loose from the front strap. i could see this happening if i carried my handgun in it and rode rough trails, but i don't. i may attempt to sew it back, but the velcro straps are starting to shred and i'd rather just get something better.if you aren't planning on riding trails or doing anything rough, this may be fine. otherwise, look at other options.

i bought this product originally for my mountain bike to replace the under the seat pouch. i thought i read that this came in multiple sizes and i was hoping it would fit. the product sent was way too large for my trek mountain bike with the water bottle holder in the same area. i wish this would have been smaller.i was however able to use it on my trek road bike but it does feel quite large on that as well

this aduro sport bicycle bike storage bag triangle saddle frame pouch was almost good enough to use.i finally got a weekend to use my bike. i went to attach the bag... and one of the velcro straps ripped immediately, rightat the seam - see pictures.i inspected the rest of the bag and all else at least seems to be intact.overall, this bag got good reviews, but i'm not one of the happy customers at this point.now i must go through the return process and wait another week or so to attempt to attach the newbag when it arrives.

biggest problem is that they punched the plastic multiple times, for multiple tags, through the main parts of the bags and so there are holes everywhere! my product came ugly with holes in it, and they didnt even punch the plastic all the way through so some are stuck forever inside your back to slide, make noise, and poke. also, definitely not water resistant. at least it will do it's job...

to make the bag nice and snug against the frame there is only about a half inch of velcro left to make the connection and there is about 4 inches of waste that has to be cut off or it will be on the way. if you have a bike with thick tubes then this will probably be great but for a touring bicycle it almost doesn't fit. i'll update how well the half an inch of velcro does after a few months of use

i returned this item. it could hold a fair amount of gear given the small size, but i could not figure out how to attach the bag to the frame securely and snugly using the oddly very long velcro straps. i may be wrong, but it seemed to me that the straps were a design flaw--there seemed no way to attach snugly so that the bag doesn't sag away from the posts to which it is attached. also, the construction of the bag seemed quite flimsy.

this seems well enough built. i will not be using the zipper too much i hope, so the highest wear item should last a long time. the same will be the case for the velcro straps as i have safe storage and will leave the bag on the bike.i keep a well stocked toolkit in it: extra tubes, 3 co2 cartridges, co2 pump\inflator, multi tool, tire levers, patch kit. there is still a little room for a couple energy bars.i will have to get a smaller water bottle as there is no longer room for a 22 oz. bottle on the seat tube.

i usually have two phones on me, my personal and work phone. one i put on my phone holder on the handlebars and the other goes in the bag. i usually also take my wallet and either my keys or my garage door opener. all of this fits comfortably in the bag with plenty of space for more stuff. during my last bike ride, my wife and i got caught in the rain. i ended up putting her phone, which is kept in a wallet holder type case, in the bag as well. everything fit and came out nice and dry. overall, very pleased with this purchase.

big enough to hold wallet, keys, mobile phone, bike tools, and snack bar. straps hold pretty tight, and it hasn't come apart after several months of 60km weekend rides. so it does what it is supposed to do.big problem is that it definitely is not waterproof. not even close. heavy rain will leak in, guaranteed, and light rain will leave everything feeling a bit damp. wrap tools in plastic, and don't leave gloves or rags in the bag, and it will be fine.so, basically, it's meh... nothing special, but it works.

cool little pouch, fits on the bike nicely doesn’t get in the way seems secure. i take it out a couple times and it holds keys phone little dog dish. my only complaint was its packaging. it had some plastic ties through the fabric that left permanent little holes in multiple spots. it works, it was an expensive, however the packaging needs to be redone. there’s no reason to put holes in something that supposed to be water resistant.

purchased this to go on my dirt bike - i ride in the country (in texas) and was looking for a bag that could carry a gun, in all honesty. we have feral hogs, bobcats, mountain lions, etc. where i bike. this bag fits my 9 mm ruger, an extra clip, sunglasses, headband, hex key set and chapstick. (i am fully aware that a 9 mm isn't going to stop a hog, but it can make them wary of you) it is easy to access on the bike, and easy to unzip, but it also stays zipped - does not vibrate the zipper) very happy with this bike bag!

this storage bag fits great on my aero bike. it holds plenty of storage(iphone 8 plus with case, keys, wallet and room for more.) i even put a can of coke in it and there was still plenty of space. although it blocks one of my bottle cages. it doesn’t block my main cage with a 25 oz bottle. i was worried that the straps weren’t going to be long enough for my wide aero frame, but there was more than enough length. as well as the option to cut the straps shorter.

i received my purchase on time and it was exactly as described. the case is well made and the colors matched my bike perfectly. i was looking for this style and i do not believe i could have found a better one! the velcro straps were the right length for my trek frame. i would purchase again if i needed another bag of this type!

not a problem on a bike but if left in the sun it starts turning purple in 4 weeks. it's still water tight and handy storage, but i mounted mine outside and it's fading after a month. most bikes would be stored in a garage so not a problem. mine is on a boat, sitting on the rail 24/7. if you want it for outside and want it to remain black, get a different one or try protective coatings to block uv.everything else about this product was great.

the bag is great for riding. it definitely serves its purpose. it holds plenty of stuff and definitely does not get in the way of riding, which was my biggest pep peeve.on a personal note (there's nothing wrong with the product), i have a diamondback override mtb with a 20" frame and i have 2 bottle cages, one for my actual water bottle and the other for my bluetooth speaker. the triangle bag gets in the way of my 1st water bottle cage, not leaving me any space for my water bottle. if i switched them around then the triangle bar muffles the hell out of the bluetooth speaker, defeating the purpose of the speaker.i've decided to keep it anyway, maybe i'll get another bike or just gift it to someone. i do like it though.

i purchased this frame bag mostly to hold extra stuff when i do rides over 50 miles. it fits securely on the frame with velcro straps that are long enough to accommodate any bike frame. any extra velcro can be cut off. the bag seems to be made well and it is big enough to hold my bike lock, iphone, gloves, energy bar and tire tools. i even stuffed a lightweight jacket in it once. for the money, you can't go wrong. it was shipped right away, packaged well and useable in a flash.

nice size and utilization of bike frame space, zippered bag.would be better if the velcro attachment were for the full length at top of bag and possibly for the side of the bag for 2 reasons,strength and rigidity.had to replace this bag after a year of 3-4 rides a week.the velco attachment was ripping off becoming unattached.it can't hold the weight of a cable and lock and cell phone.the bike path bumps and the bags weight of not even a lb. of contents will cause tearing off from attachment points.also you can't unzip bag with single hand must hold stiff with one hand before you can unzip with the other,effectively restricting access once riding bike.

perfect bag for my road bike. most bags i tried on my road bike were too bulky and my legs would bump it while pedaling. this bag is large enough to fit my keys wallet and phone in but narrow enough that i don’t notice it’s there while riding.

this bike bag is the absolute worse wast of your money. not only is it not “water proof” but it’s strap system is very weak and the bag wabbles around all the time. for an average mountain biker you carry a multi-tool, psi gauge, mini pump, lock, your phone, a spare inner tube and more. well let’s just say your not getting away with that. the most you can carry is a multi-tool and you phone and even that’s too much. the bags straps that are made out of valcrove have already fizzeled to nothing and yesterday on my first ride with this bad one of the straps just completely broke and the bad was all in my legs causing a big safety concern. over all all this bag equates too is a great job for a trail worker to pick up because you can be sure it will fall of your bike. 20/10 would not recommend.

hey just bought this pouch off amazon, quality material!! although it’s a little large but it will work. the one thing that irks me about this product is.. when i secure it to the bike tightly, the zipper is in a terrible location. the zipper falls under the crossbar, also if your secure the straps tightly like i did, it makes it difficult to zip shut. otherwise it’s just a bag and it serves it purpose.

this is a terrific bag. i needed to lose a bike bag for a new garmin radar light and this bag fit the bill much better than anticipated. i an a long time avid cyclist and have used every kind of bag on various bikes. this is an inexpensive bag easily monts and fais on my cross bike with more storage than my seat. bags.

bag has plenty of room for basic stuff that you would need: wallet or id, phone, keys. well made, will definitely stand up to long use. my only complaint? its too long to use a downtube water bottle holder on the bike. i have it on a trek verve2, with a 22 1/2” frame if that helps. pretty much the biggest “urban “ use bike they make. be careful with the velcro loops, they impede the brake cable if you have a bike that has exposed brake line. not a big deal, i used a stirring straw to cover the part that it touches. might not be a bad idea to include these in with the bag.

i got the smaller one but it is large enough to hold essentials and few other items. it would probably hold a bike lock, but as others mentioned, the velcro ties are loosely attached to back. they attach ok to the bike but look like they could tear off with a heavier load. overall looks good for light use and willing to give it a try. made in china.

i like this little bag, i got 2. easy to put on has little pouch inside, the only thing negative i have to say about it is it is a little bit large to fit on a girls bike. it just hardly has enough room to fit in that little area. at least on the bike we put it on. it will fit perfectly on the other bicycle, and it may fit on other girl bikes this one just has a spring located under the seat that makes it more difficult.

i tried to install this on my roadbike and it didn’t fit around the frame, there was too much strap material so i wasn’t able to tighten it down properly. my frame isn’t usually thin so i think this is a product design flaw beside that the bag it’s self seem like decent quality it fit all my tools( allen keys, chain breaker, tire levers) 2 new inner tubes and my bike pump which i was impressed with. another con i noticed was the bag seemed a little wide, like i would potentially rub against it while riding.

i received this bike pouch on time. installation was easy, it can fit on any bike, and it is big enough to hold phone, keys and lots of other stuff while biking. when i am not biking i place my gloves, velcro ties and what i used to hold the bike to the car carrier. i highly recommend it. this pouch is well made and looks like it will last for a while.

bought this in july of 2019. put it on my hybrid bicycle to hold my phone, wallet and keys while riding. kept my stuff dry and enough room to hold my items. after about 1 year, the material around the tabs on the top started to rip. i emailed company 2 weeks ago but still haven't heard back from them. will not buy anything from them again.

i have been using this for over a year now, i think, and it works great for me, on my trek mountain bike.. it stays where it belongs, has enough room for most of the stuff i want to carry with me.. it has my bike lock in it. along with, my tire pump, and the power bank for my phone.... i think there are a couple other small items, and there is some room left over.. i would gladly buy another, if i needed one....

this bag fits perfectly on my trek hybrid. if i had one issue (and it's minor) it would be that the velcro straps are a bit too long for my bike. i have to pull them as tight as possible to keep the bag secure. that said, i am using it to carry my cable lock so the weight in it is pretty heavy. you might not have the issue with a larger bike frame or if you're carrying lighter objects. i haven't tried it in the rain, so i can't comment on the water resistance. for me the size is perfect for the cable lock and a few other small items. overall i am very happy with this bag.

fits perfectly on my bike, capacity larger than expected. i've had it on my bike for just under two months and it's holding up really well. use two hands when you're zipping it open or closed. i've had no problems. i had a flat on a back road and was sure happy that the repair kit, my mini air pump, along with other tools were easily accessible and fit inside the bag with no issues.

i liked the bag when i first got it and strapped it onto the frame of my mountain bike. nice size, room to throw a bike tool, phone, wallet, and windbreaker in comfortably. but the product is clearly not designed to be used on a mountain bike; fifth ride and the top stitching came undone completely. it's probably fine for low-impact road biking.

i'm not particularly crazy about this thing - nothing to do with the manufacturing which seems to be good quality, it's just not a look i like, but i didn't want something that hangs under the back of the seat and requires buying a new tail light. it's adequate for my cable lock, a spare tube and my combination tool, which is all i wanted it for.'nuff said.

larger than expected. there should have been two mounting straps on the vertical mount to keep it from swinging around when hammering. i fit spoons, multi tool, tube, co2 inflator and extra canisters, with room for wallet and keys.straps designed for really fat tubing or large diameter frame construction. lots of leftover to cut, but not a lot of grip on smaller frame construction.i’ll keep it , but ordered something else that fits in a bottle cage.

i love the bag. it's very spacious, and does not get in my way at all. it is big enough to hold my wallet, keys, cell phone, c02 tire inflater, and bear spray canister (i live in the pacific northwest). i never notice it's there when i'm riding. the only downside is that it will not mount to a woman's bike (step-through frame) in a practical way, so i had to find something else for my wife's bike.

this bag has lots of room to hold your important things, including a bike lock. it also fits securely to the bike. unfortunately, it's a bit too big in that it cramps up against a standard bottle holder on the lower part of the bike. it barely fits and, even then, usually i have to push the bag off a little to the side. it works, but i wish it were a tiny bit smaller.

i ordered black, and they sent me the red and black one. i waited too long to initiate a return, so now i’m stuck with this thing, and i really hate the red one. the bag itself seems like it would be handy, and it’s easy enough to install, though a bit bigger than i expected/wanted. if you don’t hate the 80s look of the two clashing colors then you’ll probably be happy with it. the color thing is really a bummer though. wish i had initiated an exchange before it was too late.

this storage bag fits perfectly on my 26" schwinn men's deluxe suburban bicycle. the bottom touches the water bottle holder on the frame bar below it, so it couldn't be any larger. but i can easily unzip it while it's mounted and it fits my large cell phone, a small tire pump, tire patches, and a couple small bike tools, comfortably. i could stuff more in it, but it's quick convenience and keeps my cell phone out of the sun! it doesn't fit my wife's bike with the angled upper frame bar, unless there's a creative way to mount it i'm not seeing

we bought this for my 14yo son's bike so he could carry his phone while out with his friends without worrying about dropping it or it getting wet. it's the perfect size to fit all he needs (phone, keys, money), nestle well within the bike frame, and not interfere with his riding.

i have a pump, tools, 2 tubes, and some bunges in here (that i use while on the bike rack). i could probably fit a poncho (i don't plan on riding long enough to ever get stuck in bad weather). but there's plenty of room. my favorite part about it, when i want to get low (more aerodynamic), its a great place for my knees to grip and stabilize me. not sure if that's the right thing to do, but that's how i roll.

good quality, a little on the small side, but sufficient for my needs. i can fit a bottle of water inside, and the mesh pocket fits my note 4 phone no problem. i also keep my headlight battery pack and a multi tool inside. the zipper works well, the straps are plenty long enough for my top tube and seat tube. the angles of the tubes on my frame don't quite match the angles on this bag, so it doesn't have a good custom-fit look, but it'll do.

love this!! i use it on my walker. it fits nicely between the stabilizer bars and attaches to the top stabilizer bar and front vertical bar. holds my cell phone and small snack nicely. great to put silverware or scissors in so i can safely take where i need to. add some independence that i didn’t have before.

cool little storage pouch. can’t beat it for the price. bought for my commuter road bike and works as designed what can i say it’s a bag. it’s pretty big too, but not big enough to look touring like. fits my air pump. gloves, patches, spare tube, cellphone charger, and a snack or two. with room to spare.

seems fairly sturdy. given its size, i have just enough room for the bag and 1 water bottle, but not 2. note in photo that i routed the velcro straps under the rear break cable. seem ok, but hopefully it does not cause wear and tear on the cable or the bag.

i was surprised on how will this fit my small and extra small bike frames. after doing a few long rides and all kinds of weather i was pleased with how the bag stayed securely on the frame and the gear stayed dry. i wish there was a strap that attached to the down tube, but i can see how that would mot help in medium or larger frames. overall, worked great!

provides adequate storage for phone, first aid and a few tools. it seems to be well made and should last. the only downside is that i have to remove it to put the bike on the yakima carrier since the bike is supported by the tube that the bag attaches to.

it’s a lovely bag however i will be returning it. the site said it would fit on any bike and it clearly will not work for mine. it is made for a boy’s bike that has a crossbar. i have a girls bike and there is nowhere on my bicycle that i can attach this to. i was so disappointed because this is very well made and the velcro tabs hold securely.

i bought this pouch to replace a storage container that mounted above my rear tire. the new pouch is a clever design, it occupies space in the bike frame that's otherwise dead air. most importantly it does not block visibility to my rear-facing safety light. the size is perfect for my needs. it holds my wallet, phone, and car keys with space to spare. i was concerned it might inhibit access to my frame-mounted water bottle while riding, it does not. i have zero complaints.

holds a decent amount of supplies. i use it with another case that holds my phone and charger. last trip i was able to fit keys, a hat, candy bars, wallet and a few other smaller items. it is waterproof and easy to install. exactly what i was looking for. definitely would recommend.

i love the bag. it fits on the bike nicely. it’s great for cell phones, cable lock, lights, etc. looks to be good quality. the only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars is the zipper. it unzips from the bottom. things can fall out from that corner. it’s needs to zip from either direction or at least unzip from the top. that way you wouldn’t have to unzip all the way and your stuff would not fall out.

this is better and bigger than i was expecting. you can fit phones, tubes, wrenches, wallet, a lot, a lot is what you can fit into this bag. i even put my water bottle into it for a ride bc my bike doesn’t have a bottle mount. it’s easy to install, spacious and so far seems well made and durable. i don’t think you can go wrong with this purchase.

this bicycle pouch arrived in good condition, installed easily and does everything i expected it to do. it does not get in the way while i'm riding my bike and carries all the items i need while on the road. my garage door opener, identification and cash all fit in the pouch and there is room for additional items if needed. the zipper opening is located so it can be accessed without removing the pouch from the bike, but if i am leaving the bike somewhere where i can't see it i can easily remove the pouch and take it with me.

picked this up to put my keys, wallet and phone under my road bike. i've done a few 10+ mile rides with it and it's hardly noticeable. there are times where it seems to stick out every so slightly causing me to rub against it, but it doesn't happen frequently enough to take it off. i feel that may be from a lack of "breaking in" on my part, anyway.

works great! it can fit bike tools and 2 inner tubes easily. i could also put my wallet and phone in it as well! there's not really any security features. you just velcro strap it to your bike and there's a zipper. seems pretty water resistant!

the storage bag easily attached to my bike with the velcro straps. though the size isn't super large, you can easily store you main essentials like a phone, keys, wallet, power bar, and water without interfering with your legs. the only con is that a wish the zipper was on the side and not the bottom. it makes it hard to get stuff out without having to first get off your bike.

wrap the velcro straps on a bike with 1" frame tubes and the two velcro sides that have to mesh don't line up. as is, the bag cannot be attached to the frame of the bike. i am not sending it back, however. i will remove about an inch from the middle of each strap each strap and resew the velcro to the new position.upon learning of the problems i had with their product, entronik. issued a full refund for the cost of the bag and shipping. with the straps modified by my wife, the bag proved quite satisfactory.

was looking for a good, affordable storage solutions for bike necessities, and this is exactly what i needed. the bag is very large, yet not bulky enough to be in the way of anything. i'm hoping it holds for a few years, but from what i see, the materials are of pretty decent quality, so hopefully that won't be an issue.

i needed a new storage compartment for my bike. i had outgrown my old one, or at least my cellphone did. this one was actually a bit bigger than i expected (tbf i didn't bother to measure). this one has plenty of room for a phone, wallet, keys, and a multitool. its almost too big. its right against my water bottle but neither seem to mind.

this is a very nice bag but i could not give 5 stars, only because the velcro is not exactly the length it needs to be for perfect fit. i stitched a piece of velcro onto the bag so i could make it much more secure and not be able to rock from side to side as i ride. it also would help if there was a zipper or larger separator inside to divide tools from electronics (scratching).

love this bag. problem: i live in portland and it rains all the time. everything inside which is cloth gets soaked. otherwise good product. has a lot more space than anticipated. keep the follow inside it: inner tube, tool kit, lube, chapstick, gloves, scissors, and patch kit. plenty of extra space.

my bike already had handlebar and under-the-seat bags for various supplies. i needed another bag to hold a fresh shirt for long hot rides or a windbreaker for rides that start off cool in the morning but heat up as the day wears on. this bag is perfect for that use. it fits perfectly on my bike frame and is the perfect size for holding a folded up shirt or windbreaker. it secures well to the frame and adds very little weight to the bike.

no complaints here! wanted something to keep my phone and other small items in. product is bigger than what i was expecting which is fine by me. i actually keep a 12-16? oz poland spring bottle in there as i don't have a water bottle holder on my bike. 🖒🖒

perfect to carry up to two wallets, two phones, keys, and a pair of glasses. it’s just what i was looking for! compact, well made, just enough room for the essentials. no more back pack to carry a few little things!

we don't ride a ton so i can't speak to the longevitity / durability, but so far we're pleased with this pouch. plenty of room for phone, wallet, and much more. the interior pocket is nice, to keep things from bumping into each other (we place phone in pocket)fit great on an adult male bike. probably wouldn't fit a female bike.

my hub got a new bicycle that he has been riding regularly, and was caught in the rain, with his cell phone on the bike, he had to find shelter so that the phone wouldn't get wet. i immediately hunted this down for a christmas present. he loves it, it doesn't get in the way while he's riding and since it's waterproof, he can easily slip his phone and other small items into the pouch and be confident that all will be safe and dry.

your browser does not support html5 video. wow, i was pleasantly surprised by this lightweight yet effective storage bag. it held my iphone xr plus my keychain with multiple keys and hand sanitizer with still more space to fit more things. it conveniently sits under my bike seat so it doesn’t get in the way while i bike. i chose this over a phone mount & regularly have my airpods playing my spotify playlist while my phone is safely stored in this bag. highly recommend!!

this bag is big enough to store my wallet, keys, pepper spray and a tightly-rolled light jacket. it’s easy to access as well with the zipper being along the top and off to the side. the only thing is that i had to kind of smush it into place above my water bottle holder; it’s a bit large for my bike frame. but even so, i made do and it looks great!worth every penny!

ok, this is kind of a no-brainer and i certainly don't fault amazon or the manufacturer for this, but i transport my bicycles using a rack that hangs the bikes from the top tube of the bike, so this storage bag interferes with my car rack. i, therefore, don't use this bag. seems well-constructed and unobtrusive otherwise, though.

small and does not get in the way but big enough to carry a mini-pump, travel card, some cash, smartphone and a few crucial tools and a spare inner tube. requires two tubes to fasten to so will not work with all frame geometries

sometimes in life, it's the simple things that make all the difference. what can i say about this bike bag that hasn't been said by so many other happy customers? so far, i have been using it almost daily for 15 months, in all 4 seasons (yes, even in winter). not only does it carry and protect lot's of essentials, but it even makes my bike look better. the bike seems naked without it. whoever designed this deserves a medal of recognition. i just can't think of anything not to like about this bag. anyone who rides a bicycle should have at least one of these.

this is a cute little storage area that doesn’t get in my way. it will hold glasses, keys and your phone easily. (fits my iphone7). i would want to over fill it since it is on the frame just below the seat and would probably bump your legs when you pedal. i really like it and feel safer having my phone ride there than in the basket which can allow it to bounce out.

just installed, so no durability info as yet. the bag itself seems solid, is spacious, but like at least 1 other review on this site ... the velcro straps are much too long. mine is a specialized road bike with largish aluminum tubes and to give you an idea .. i'll be cutting about 2" off the straps to make them fit. seems excessive, thus 1 star off.

it’s a great bag end for me it actually had a little too much space and was a little larger than i needed but for many of the extra space would be welcome. i do wish it had a second outside zipper space even a thin one but overall it was a very good product

seriously, who the hell decided the straps needed to be this long? there isn't a way to tuck the extra slack. i'd have to cut and resew them just to get rid of the excessive length. the bag itself feels cheaper than i was expecting. i also hate that the zipper opens on the left side, but that's just me.
this bag fits perfectly on my bike, even with a water bottle holder! the best part is that it fits so many items in there and the zipper ensures that i don't lose anything along the way.

i saw reviews about straps not being long enough and frayed fabric inside near the zipper area. neither was an issue for me. it holds all my first aid stuff and i even put a coiled bike lock in it. held everything no problem. i have a specialized road bike and the bar i strapped it to was definitely not skinny. perhaps improvements have been made.

this bag can hold a lot. i'm able to store plastic grocery bags, my wallet, my keys, my phone, my mask, and there's still room. despite all this storage capacity, it doesn't look bulky. it looks like it goes naturally with the bike.

this storage bag holds more than my small saddle bag hanging from the bike seat. also, it doesn't obstruct the seat post from attaching a blinking red led light for safety purposes riding on busy streets. i carry a cable and lock, iphone and a small flat tire kit with room to spare.

this bag has an excellent amount of space and fit well to my bike. initially i was stoked with this purchase, as the main reason i bought this was to carry a few bike maintenance tools and my kryptonite lock (which is a hefty lock). all was good for a couple of weeks. however, i started to notice a good bit of wear around the attachment points of the bag. the stitching was fine. it was the material that the straps were stitched to that was failing. now the bag shifts around a lot and is quite annoying to ride with. it's lightweight but not durable to daily use carrying anything heavy. overall it's a good bag for the price, as long as you don't plan to carry much weight with it daily. i also forgot to mention that it got rained on and all the contents inside were soaked. just keep that in mind.

i bought this bike storage bag to hold my binoculars. you see, where i mostly ride is on a river trail where there is plenty of wild life. i keep my binoculars handy for when i spot interesting critters. the bag is very well made and fits the binoculars perfectly. that's not to say it will fill all binoculars since there are many that are larger than what i have, but it's perfect for mine.

i bought is to hold bike tools in case of a breakdown on the road. it is perfect size sturdy and the way it mounts it is easy to install and remove. has ample room for the necessary bike tools. it is out of way and you do not know it is there. would definitely recommend and would buy again.

the aduro sport bicycle bike storage bag is durable, stylish, and functional. it has a high-quality construction and plenty of storage space for your cycling essentials. furthermore, i appreciate the variety of color choices that allowed me to match my road bike's color scheme perfectly. overall, it is easy to access, mounts securely and quickly, plus it will keep your items safe while you focus on your ride.

i feel that the bag is nicely made but i have a road bike and the straps are too long and do not have a tight grip with velcro straps. if i cut the straps then strap wont work. probably made for larger bikes. i just wont valuables in this bag in case it falls off.

i was a little skeptical about this actually fitting in the inside corner of my bike frame with the water bottle, but it is absolutely perfect! it is a nice tight fit with the looped velcro straps and takes up no more space than the frame itself. i am very impressed. now i can ride with my phone safely tucked away instead of in my pocket.

the velcro is too long & hangs over so that your legs rub against the rough part while riding. the bag is too wide & you constantly brush against it while riding. you can try & attach it the the front of the frame but it’s designed for the back. it can fit your phone & keys but it can’t even fit a plastic water bottle. unfortunately, my roommate threw out the packaging so i’m stuck with this.

good quality product for the price and easy to install. if your brake cables run along the frame make sure to run the straps between the cables and the frame to avoid tightening your cables.i use it to hold my repair kit and a co2 pump. i take out one star out because it doesn't have a rigid frame and tends to lose its nice shape when heavier objects, such as a cable lock, are placed in it. i highly recommend it for lighter objects.
great bag. very durable. survived a week of roughmountain biking in moab utah with no issues. rained a bit as well as crossing creeks and pounding puddles and everything stayed dry.

i like this saddle bag. i am able to add a lot of small items including tools, power bank to charge my phone or wireless headphones and any other small items. it does attach to the bike in the area of a second water bottle. if you don't have a second bottle holder this fits great but not so much if you do have another bottle holder.

i really like this little thing. you don't normally think of your bicycle frame being a usuable space, but this makes it usuable & doesn't interfere with the function of the bike. great for storing a phone, keys, wallet, tire pressure gauge, etc. while riding.

this item is a waste of time. the first thing i did after receiving it was throw it in the trash. material is really thin and you cannot see this in the pictures, but having it on your bike means that both of your water bottl mounts are useless. i don't usually like to go on somewhere and be so negative, but in this case it is warranted! buyer beware!

i haven't used it for mountain biking, but it seems sturdy enough for that. if it fits your frame for road biking or commuting i really see no reason not to buy this though. the only thing i dislike, and this is being picky, is that sometimes my leg rubs against the excess velcro, but my bike frame is very skinny so this shouldn't be a common problem. it's a little difficult to close while riding but you're not really supposed to do that anyway, so i see nothing wrong here.

the product was delivered on time. the bag is well constructed and holds essential tools for flats. including co2 inflator, extra cartridges, chain tool, spare master link, tire wrenches, multi-tool, wallet and cell phone. there remains room for more items. this is the medium-size bag and the zipper is well-placed to open it quickly.
product looked and felt nice. sturdy material and construction.does not fit on a lg frame bike that has a water bottle cage. the two do not work together and water wins over storage anytime.

this is a well made and durable bag - it fits my husband bike perfectly... mine, no so much. if you have a women's bike make sure you take measurements to see if it will fit. it will technically fit on mine but i will have to remove the bottle cage that i already have on. from another reviewer, it looks like the bag does not fit at all in some cases. just measure your bike before you buy! overall it is still a great product.

i bought this on the positive reviews but didn’t realize until i got it that i had no room for it on my frame. so i installed as a “mini-pannier” on my rack instead and couldn’t be happier. the zipper is to the side and easy to access and has lots of room. it’s great for casual riding when you want to carry a wallet, phone, glasses, etc. if the manufacturer would shorten the velcro straps for a rack, it could be easily sold for both applications!
this bag works great. it has a large capacity. it doesn’t get in the way when peddling.i have a 21 inch frame and it fits great.i bought my wife one and it’s a really tight fit on her bike.

i settled on this one after trying two others. i have it on my 10 speed mounted on the cross bar and the front neck. this way it does not interfere with my leg motion. not a lot of storage but works well.

great bag, i've seen reviews saying that the velcro isn't strong enough, but i put a heavy kryptonite chain lock in it and have never had any issues, i've had it for almost 3 years and would highly recommend it.

this pouch is very handy to store my keys, wallet and cell phone while riding my bicycle. i would recommend to anyone that rides bike and does not want to carry anything in their pockets. it just makes riding so much more comfortable. i'm very happy with the purchase.

i’m very happy with this storage pouch, it has a good amount of room and fits snugly on my bikes frame. i have it 3 stars for security because it can’t be locked or otherwise secured, but i didn’t buy it for theft deterring. it’s a great pouch.

the idea around a triangular zipper pouch velcro attached is great but the materials left a lot to be desired. mine arrived with scuffs and pierce marks, more like the cheapest chinese backpackyou may find in downtown la . so i sprayed it with some waterproofing compound to make it stiffer, then added firm foam from some offroad lights to make some sort of structure and compartments inside. it will do the job but really it does not worth more than 2 or 3 bucks.

nicely designed. large enough to fit a flat kit, phone, wallet plus more, while the bag itself does not interfere with my riding, nor the water bottle cage. it's stable and have been in place for over 300 miles now.
it’s a cool little bag and works as intended. happy with purchase. check out the dimensions in advance to make sure you have room left for your other gear. there is no security. it’s just a zip bag.

this is a really nice bag to keep a compact tool, first aid kit, and other items you may need while on your commute or on the trail. it was very easy to mount, and stays in place. it does get in the way of my lower mount for my water cage, but that is a trade out i can live with. would recommend it.

you get what you pay for. very poor quality all over. zipper, material, flimsy, velcro, etc...the whole thing is very poor quality and it looks very cheap..as it is. design is also terrible. returning!.. paying for something little better next time.

i wanted this bag to hold the controller for my e-bike conversion. so far it has worked out perfectly. it’s big enough to hold the controller and extra wires and small enough not to interfere with the battery, which is mounted in the water bottle holes. it’s seems to be of good quality. i’m pleased and would recommend this bag.
i do some occasional day biking and don’t want to wear a backpack through the woods. this item is perfect for iphone, keys, repair tools, and other incidentals that you might need.

nice little bag. it was a bit larger than i thought it would be, but there was plenty enough room for this bag and my water bottle below it. this bag was so surprisingly large that it easily fit my spare inner tube, mini pump, and still have room for snacks.

the bag is very sturdy and the straps hold the bag securely to the bike frame. i have mine on a pedego city cruiser and use the internal pouch for my phone charging cable. the pouch as enough room to hold my bike tools, and co2 ultraflate tire inflator as well as my wallet. although i have not had to i would remove it when i lock my bike up. it is very convenient and the zipper function has been flawless.

this thing lasted maybe 3 months on mtn bike ridden 3x per week and two top straps broke. i catch "urban air", do great wheelies, and ride 20% dirt single track (take what you can get), so if you are lucky enough to do real mountain biking all the time, this won't last you a month. probably good for street rider.

one velcro strap broke less than 5 minutes into my ride. the second velcro strap was holding on by threads a few minutes later. i had a spare tube, co2 cartridge and inflator, multi tool, wallet, and phone in the bag. i feel it should have no problem holding essentials without a complete failure.
i can stick my phone, wallet, keys and so much more in my bike pouch. it comes in handy when i’m biking and don’t want to carry items in my pockets. easy to secure everything.

the product works as advertised. i had an under seat bag prior to this that required me to pick and choose the gear i could bring on the ride. this product allows me to empty my pockets upon arrival and place it in the bag. in addition, i ride now with a multi-purpose bike wrench, air pump and patch kit should the unthinkable occur with room to spare.

large carrying capacity. i can easily fit my wallet keys phone and some tools in this bag with space to spare. the internal mesh liner is great for separating scratch prone items, like my phone, from everything else. i use a large u lock, but if i used a cable style lock it would fit here quite easily. a real bargain for the price. i would have been happy paying $30 for it.

this bag is great. it holds quite a bit and i hardly realize that it is there while riding! the straps do an awesome job holding it firmly in place. if you’re looking for a bag to fit on the frame, you can definitely purchase this one with confidence. (i did go over the lettering with a sharpie on mine 😎)

avoid this productit does not hold well on the bike frame. constantly swings back and forth interfering with peddling. the straps (all 3) do not hold tightly, and are way to long with nowhere to put the excess, so they scratch you while riding. basically, between the bag swinging, and the excess straps scratching you this bag makes it unbearable to ride the bike!

how it mounts and its size it just right for my use. i thought it a little odd that the zipper is on the left instead of the right, being most people are right handed, but no big drawback. i did not like the big brand-name logo put on it, and the biggest dislike to the pouch, and i put some black ink to the logo to at least dull it out, being it distracted from the looks of my bicycle, in my opinion. i don't like bill-boarded brand names on products.

i finally got an opportunity to use this product on a 10 mile bike ride yesterday it fits my keys my phone and a couple other assorted items and it kept it secure and it sat right above my water bottle. it is absolutely perfect for my needs and i would recommend it for anyone who has to carry essentials while riding

i needed a place to put essentials (phone wallet keys and water) while riding, and it's very out of the way with this pack. it's able to hold a regular sized water bottle without much trouble, though i don't think that's what it was even meant for. great pack!

i love this bag. it is made of great quality, holds all my tools, and phone with room to spare. it fits perfectly on my bike. it was bigger than i anticipated but it fit my bike snugly and the zipper is to the side of the straps so it is easily accessible.
got this so i could empty pockets on bike rides keep id , air pump and contact case still room for more no problem with any interference with legs while pedaling

ordered this bag for my roadbikeonly ordered one but they sent and charged me for two but they were so nice i didnt even bother sending one backordered it in blue but also got a black one that looked way better on my roadbikeif ur looking for an affordable nice frame bag for ur bike to ad a lil storage you cant really go wrong with the aduro triangle strap on

i was worried it would be too big, it is not. my lock fits in the bag, with my cell phone, and a wrench. it streamlines with the bars above, behind and below. thus my legs are never going to hit the bag when i peddle and fly down the bike path. one last thing, it looks like i picked the perfect color as well.

after installing the first bag, i noticed a seperated seam on the bottom edge. amazon quickly replaced the bag, and the new one is in much better condition. it's held up well on several rides, but it does take some adjustment to fit the frame properly.

i like everything neat and tiddy. my issue with the aduro bicycle storage bag is that it slips forward and downfrom the position in the picture. this could be fixed if the velcro straps were attached closer to the apex of this 90 degree triangle. the bag slips out of position because the back side of the velcro straps can't get a grip on the shiny surface of the top tube and seat tube. picky, plcky, plcky, lol

i ride my bike into work nearly everyday. this little pouch is great for holding my simple cord/lock, wallet, cell phone, and keys. if you are looking to tour de france or cross country and this will carry heavy gear, you picked the wrong underslung baggie. i especially like how easily i can access the pouch through the zipper while i am pedaling.

this thing went on my bike great, but one of the strap buckles broke a week after i got it. i managed to replace the buckle with a small carabiner i had and secure it back to the bike...then a week later the zipper split open. total waste of money. if it wasn't such awful quality it would be great. but it's useless after you use it a couple of times and it starts falling apart.

storage bag is very handy especially for long rides. it's easy to fit multiple items within the frame bag. the bag allows one to store enough essentials like small snacks, a phone, wallet and some spare bike tools. the only negative i can point out is that the bag isn't all that waterproof, so i would suggest placing water-sensitive items within a plastic bag inside the storage bag. stitching doesn't seem too bad; only time will tell how it holds up.
